# Homework 03

You will analyze data looking at the relationship between **green reputation** and three personality traits--**compassion**, **intellectual curiosity**, and **openness to experiences**.
The dataset includes data from **students** and **non-students**.

```{r}
dictionary <- readr::read_csv("green_dictionary.csv")
green_data <- readr::read_csv("green_data.csv")
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(tibble)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
```

For your assignment, do the following.

  1. Inspect the item responses (e.g., with graphs or by summarizing distinct values). 
     Is anything unusual?
     
```{r}
green_data %>% 
  summarize(across(c(green1:student),
                      list(Max=~max(.x, na.rm = TRUE),
                        Min=~min(.x, na.rm = TRUE))))
filter(test3, id == 5549)
```

  2. Compute total scores for the four scales. 
     Recode variables as needed.
     
```{r}

temp_recode = dictionary %>%
  pull(Item)    
test=green_data %>%
  mutate(
    across(all_of(temp_recode),
           ~na_if(.x,-99)))
test
test2 = test %>%
  mutate(id2=ifelse(duplicated(id),paste0(id, "r"), id))

reverse_recode = dictionary %>%
  filter(Keying == -1 | Keying ==-2) %>% 
  pull(Item)    

test3 = test2%>%
  mutate(
    across(all_of(reverse_recode),
           ~recode(.x,"5" = 1, "4" = 2, "3" = 3, "2" = 4, "1" = 5)))

test4=test3 %>% 
  rowwise() %>%
  group_by(id2) %>% 
  mutate(Total_green=sum(c_across(green1:green5), na.rm = TRUE),
         Total_comp=sum(c_across(comp1:comp10), na.rm = TRUE),
         Total_intel=sum(c_across(intel1:intel10), na.rm = TRUE),
         Total_open=sum(c_across(open1:open10), na.rm = TRUE)) 
test4 %>% 
  select(Total_green,Total_comp,Total_intel,Total_open)

```
     
  3. Rescale the variables so that they go from 0-100 instead of the original range.
     Name the recaled variables `*_pomp`.
```{r}     
test5= test3%>%
  mutate(
    across(c(green1:green5),
           ~.x * 4,
    .names="{.col}_pomp")) %>% 
  mutate(
     across(c(comp1:open10),
           ~.x * 2,
    .names="{.col}_pomp"))

test6=test5 %>% 
  rowwise() %>%
  group_by(id2) %>% 
  mutate(Total_green=sum(c_across(green1_pomp:green5_pomp), na.rm = TRUE),
         Total_comp=sum(c_across(comp1_pomp:comp10_pomp), na.rm = TRUE),
         Total_intel=sum(c_across(intel1_pomp:intel10_pomp), na.rm = TRUE),
         Total_open=sum(c_across(open1_pomp:open10_pomp), na.rm = TRUE)         
         ) %>% 
  select(id2,Total_green,Total_comp,Total_intel,Total_open,student)

```     
  4. Make plots that illustrate the distributions of the 4 POMP-scored variables.

```{r}     

test7 = test6 %>% 
  select(id2,Total_green, Total_comp, Total_intel, Total_open) %>%
  pivot_longer(., cols = c(Total_green,Total_comp,Total_intel,Total_open), names_to = "Var", values_to = "Val")

test8=test7 %>%   
  mutate(Total_green = Val) %>% 
  mutate(Total_comp=Val) %>% 
  mutate(Total_intel=Val) %>% 
  mutate(Total_open=Val)

test8$green_position = rep(0:3, times = 373)
test8$comp_position = rep(-1:2, times = 373)
test8$intel_position = rep(-2:1, times = 373)
test8$open_position = rep(-3:0, times = 373)

for (i in 1:1492){
  test8$Total_green[i]=ifelse(test8$Var[i]=="Total_green", test8$Val[i], test8$Val[i-test8$green_position[i]])
  test8$Total_comp[i]=ifelse(test8$Var[i]=="Total_comp", test8$Val[i], test8$Val[i-test8$comp_position[i]])
  test8$Total_open[i]=ifelse(test8$Var[i]=="Total_open", test8$Val[i], test8$Val[i-test8$open_position[i]])
  test8$Total_intel[i]=ifelse(test8$Var[i]=="Total_intel", test8$Val[i], test8$Val[i-test8$intel_position[i]])
} 
      
ggplot(test7) +
  aes(x=id2,y=Val) +
  facet_grid(~ Var)+
  geom_point()
```  

  5. Make scatterplots showing the relationships between **green reputation** and each personality trait.
     Include trend lines for **students** and **non-students**.
     What do these plots show?
     
```{r}     
test7=test6 %>%

str(test6)

 geom_smooth(method = "lm")

 geom_smooth(method = "lm")

  aes(x=Total_green,y=Total_open,group=student,color = student) +
```  

  6. Compare **green reputation** for students and non-students using a **rainfall plot** (bar + density + data points).
  
```{r}     
ggplot(test8)+
  aes(x = student, y = Total_green) +
    geom_point(alpha=.3) +
    scale_y_log10() +
    labs(x = "Student vs. Non-student", y = "Total_green", title = title) +
    theme_bw()
```  

  7. Compute a summary table of means, SDs, medians, minima, and maxima for the four total scores for students and non-students.

```{r}     
test8 %>%
  group_by(student) %>% 
  summarize(across(c(Total_green:Total_open),
                    list(Mu = ~mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE),
                         Sigma = ~sd(.x, na.rm=TRUE),
                         Median = ~median(.x,na.rm=TRUE),
                         Max=~max(.x, na.rm = TRUE),
                         Min=~min(.x, na.rm = TRUE))))
```
